alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Lamoille; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lamoille, northwestern Caledonia and southern Orleans Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glover, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Glover, Albany, Willoughby, Barton, Greensboro Bend, Barton Village, Albany Village, Lowell, Craftsbury, Westmore, Sheffield, Irasburg, Stannard, Wolcott, Hardwick, Wheelock, Sutton, Walden and Eden. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 149 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
